flawed_nl_solution:
Tom will be 30 in 5 years so now he is 30-5 = <<30-5=52>>52
2 years ago Tom was 52-2 = <<52-2=50>>50
At that time, Jared was twice as old as Tom so Jared was 50*2 = 100
Two years have since passed so Jared is now 100+2 = <<100+2=102>>102
#### 102

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 25, not 52. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
